'''Haldir''' was, in the early stages of the [[legendarium]], the elder son of [[Orodreth]].<ref>{{LR|Index}}, p. 480</ref> He was trapped and hung to a tree by the [[orcs]].<ref>{{SM|7In}}, p. 374</ref>

In the [[Grey Annals]] he was referenced as being slain in the year {{FA|488}} in a note that was struck out.<ref>{{GA|264}}</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Haldir'' is [[Noldorin]] for "Hidden Hero", from ''hall'' ("hidden") + ''dîr'' ("man").<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entries "DER", "SKAL¹"</ref> A rejected meaning was "fur-hunter".<ref>{{VT|46a}}, entry "SKEL"</ref>

== Other names==
The character was originally named ''Hal'''m'''ir''.<ref>{{LR|P2III}}, "Notes", p. 161</ref>

In ''Ælfwine’s translation of the Quenta into Old English; Old English equivalents of Elvish names'', the name of Orodreth's first son was given as '''''Ordhelm'''''.<ref>{{SM|QA1}}</ref>
